intro: Grammitis rojasii, commonly known as the Rojas' filmy fern, is a rare and delicate species of fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its small, intricate, and delicate fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions with high humidity. Its spores are released in tiny, clustered structures called sporangia, which are typically located on the underside of the fronds. Grammitis rojasii is of particular interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
